page.title: 11EAST HANNINGFIELD
page.content: East Hanningfield is a village, surrounded by flat farmland, adjoining Bicknacre on its north-east boundary and approximately 4 miles to the east boundary of Chelmsford. The population of 1000 has increased by two-thirds during the last 4 years. Four new estates have been built in discreet positions so as to preserve the old-world look of the village. The 100-year old church replaces the Saxon one that was destroyed by fire and stands on the main road at the north entrance to the village. The Southend-Chelmsford bus runs through the village hourly, offering regular transport for workers at the small industries. There is a public house, restaurant and a modern Church of England school.
